alertId.description: The GUID uniquely identifying the alert instance.

alertRule.description: The name of the alert rule that generated the alert instance.

severity.description: The severity of the alert. Possible values: Sev0, Sev1, Sev2, Sev3, or Sev4.

signalType.description: Identifies the signal on which the alert rule was defined. Possible values: Metric, Log, or Activity Log.

monitorCondition.description: When an alert fires, the alert's monitor condition is set to Fired. When the underlying condition that caused the alert to fire clears, the monitor condition is set to Resolved.

monitoringService.description: The monitoring service or solution that generated the alert. The fields for the alert context are dictated by the monitoring service.

alertTargetIDs.description: The list of the Azure Resource Manager IDs that are affected targets of an alert. For a log alert defined on a Log Analytics workspace or Application Insights instance, it's the respective workspace or application

originAlertId.description: The ID of the alert instance, as generated by the monitoring service generating it.

firedDateTime.description: The date and time when the alert instance was fired in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

resolvedDateTime.description: The date and time when the monitor condition for the alert instance is set to Resolved in UTC. Currently only applicable for metric alerts.

description.description: The description, as defined in the alert rule.

essentialsVersion.description: The version number for the essentials section.

alertContextVersion.description: The version number for the alertContext section.
